item.title: 独家新闻消息人士称，特朗普空军提名人以有利于马斯克的 SpaceX 公司的方式安排卫星合同
item.description: 据七位熟悉合同的人士透露，唐纳德-特朗普总统提名的空军部长人选，目前是国家间谍卫星机构的一名高级官员，以有利于埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 SpaceX 公司的方式安排了一份数十亿美元的合同招标。【原文：President Donald Trump's nominee as Air Force Secretary, currently a top official at the national spy satellite agency, arranged a multibillion-dollar contract solicitation in a way that favored Elon Musk's SpaceX, according to seven people familiar with the contract.】

item.title: 消息人士称新日铁并未放弃对美国钢铁公司的竞购
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普早些时候表示，日本钢铁制造商将 "投资 "美国钢铁公司，但不会收购美国钢铁公司，但两位接近该交易的人士周五表示，新日铁并未撤回其 149 亿美元的收购美国钢铁公司的出价。【原文：Nippon steel has not withdrawn its $14.9 billion bid to buy U.S. Steel , two people close to the deal said on Friday, after President Donald Trump said earlier the Japanese steelmaker would "invest" in US Steel but not buy it.】

item.title: 美国银行首席执行官莫伊尼汉的薪酬在 2024 年增至 3500 万美元
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）在周五提交的一份文件中称，该公司将首席执行官布莱恩-莫伊尼汉（Brian Moynihan）2024 年的薪酬提高了约 21%，达到 3500 万美元。【原文：Bank of America Corp increased the compensation for Chief Executive Officer Brian Moynihan by roughly 21% to $35 million for 2024, the lender said in a filing on Friday.】

item.title: 赫兹公司在特拉华州胜诉，驳回了有关授权令的诉讼
item.description: 赫兹全球控股公司（Hertz Global Holdings）周五赢得了一项诉讼的撤诉，该诉讼声称该租车公司在进行一系列融资交易后，必须赎回股东的普通股认股权证。【原文：Hertz Global Holdings on Friday won the dismissal of a lawsuit claiming that the rental car company was required to redeem shareholders' common stock warrants after undergoing a series of financing transactions.】

item.title: 特朗普与日本首相称日本正考虑投资而非购买美国钢铁
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普和日本首相石破茂周五表示，日本正在考虑对美国钢铁公司进行投资，而不是收购。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said on Friday Japan was looking at an investment in U.S. Steel instead of an acquisition.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国银行将从加拿大道明银行购买 90 亿美元的住宅抵押贷款
item.description: 周五，一位熟悉内情的消息人士称，美国银行已同意从加拿大贷款机构多伦多道明银行（Toronto-Dominion Bank）购买价值 90 亿美元的住宅抵押贷款组合。【原文：Bank of America has agreed to buy a $9 billion portfolio of residential mortgage loans from Canadian lender Toronto-Dominion Bank , a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国运通称发现 30 个消费者账户可能与伊朗政府有关联
item.description: 美国信用卡巨头美国运通（American Express）周五表示，去年已发现约 30 个消费者账户可能与伊朗政府有关。【原文：U.S. credit card giant American Express said on Friday it had identified approximately 30 consumer accounts last year that might have been tied to the government of Iran.】

item.title: 摩根大通任命赛伯和史密斯为商业银行部联席主管
item.description: 摩根大通周五表示，在继续重组商业银行部的同时，任命马特-赛博（Matt Sable）和梅丽莎-史密斯（Melissa Smith）为商业银行部联席主管。【原文：JPMorgan Chase appointed Matt Sable and Melissa Smith as co-heads of commercial banking, the largest U.S. lender said on Friday, as it continues to reorganize the unit.】

item.title: 空中客车公司推迟开发新型氢飞机
item.description: 空中客车公司周五表示，该公司将推迟在下个十年中期开发氢动力商用飞机的计划，理由是技术发展速度低于预期。【原文：Airbus said on Friday it is delaying plans to develop a hydrogen-powered commercial aircraft by the middle of next decade, citing slower than expected developments in technology.】

item.title: 2025 年经济形势迷雾重重，各国央行努力应对不确定性
item.description: 2025 年央行的首次利率变动表明，在这一年里，世界发达国家和新兴国家的一些重要重量级企业将暂时朝着不同的方向发展。【原文：The first central bank interest rate moves of 2025 suggest it will be a year where some important heavyweights, in both the developed and emerging parts of the world, travel in different directions for a while.】

item.title: Coinbase 必须在纽约面对客户诉讼
item.description: 一名联邦法官周五裁定，Coinbase 必须面对客户的诉讼，客户指控这家美国最大的加密货币交易所在未注册为经纪商的情况下非法销售证券。【原文：Coinbase must face a lawsuit by customers who accused the largest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange of illegally selling securities without registering as a broker-dealer, a federal judge ruled on Friday.】

item.title: 汽车制造商敦促美国交通部尽快重启联邦电动汽车充电计划
item.description: 代表汽车制造商和电动汽车充电公司的一个团体周五敦促美国交通部尽快重启一项价值 50 亿美元的政府电动汽车基础设施计划。【原文：A group representing automakers and electric vehicle charging companies on Friday urged the U.S. Transportation Department to quickly restart a $5 billion government EV infrastructure program.】

item.title: 比尔-阿克曼增持股份后，优步股价跃升至三个月高点
item.description: 周五，在亿万富翁对冲基金经理比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）宣布入股优步（Uber）共享出行平台后，优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）的股价跃升至三个月来的新高。【原文：Shares of Uber Technologies jumped to a three-month high on Friday after billionaire hedge fund manager Bill Ackman announced that he had taken a position in the ride sharing platform.】

item.title: 贝克休斯称美国钻井商连续第二周增加石油和天然气钻机
item.description: 能源服务公司贝克休斯周五在其密切关注的报告中称，美国能源公司本周连续第二周增加石油和天然气钻机，这是自2024年7月以来的首次。【原文：U.S. energy firms this week added oil and natural gas rigs for a second week in a row for the first time since July 2024, energy services firm Baker Hughes said in its closely followed report on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道泽连斯基说 "我们做个交易吧"，向特朗普提供矿产合作，寻求安全保障
item.description: 乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）周五在接受路透社采访时，仔细研究了一份曾经被列为机密的稀土和其他重要矿产的巨大矿藏地图，这是向唐纳德-特朗普寻求交易的努力的一部分。【原文：Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy pored over a once-classified map of vast deposits of rare earths and other critical minerals during an interview with Reuters on Friday, part of a push to appeal to Donald Trump's penchant for a deal.】

item.title: 据哥伦比亚广播公司新闻报道，特朗普考虑允许新日铁以 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司
item.description: 据哥伦比亚广播公司（CBS News）周五报道，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普正在考虑允许日本新日铁完成对美国钢铁公司 149 亿美元的收购。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump is considering allowing Japan's Nippon Steel to complete its $14.9 billion buyout of United States Steel , CBS News reported on Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普表示希望减少与日本的贸易逆差
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五在白宫会见日本首相石破茂时表示，他希望努力减少与日本的贸易逆差。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that he wants to work on reducing the trade deficit with Japan, as he met with Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba at the White House.】

item.title: 特朗普签署命令，推迟对从中国进口的微量商品加征关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周五签署了一项行政命令，推迟对来自中国的微量或低成本包裹征收关税，直到商务部能够确认处理包裹和征收关税的程序和系统已经到位。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday signed an executive order delaying tariffs on de minimis, or low-cost, packages from China until the Commerce Department can confirm that procedures and systems are in place to process packages and collect tariff revenue.】

item.title: 美联储主席库格勒称劳动力市场健康，通胀上升
item.description: 周五，美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）在讲话中表示，她预计本季度经济将继续保持稳健增长，并指出通胀进展缓慢，特朗普政府的政策将对经济产生何种影响尚不明确。【原文：In remarks that suggest she is in no hurry to cut interest rates, Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler on Friday said she expects continued solid economic growth this quarter, and noted slow progress on inflation and a lack of clarity on how the Trump administration's policies will affect the economy.】

item.title: 美国政府 1 月份新增 9,000 个工作岗位，预计不会持续增长
item.description: 1 月份美国政府新增了 9000 名工作人员，由于唐纳德-特朗普总统希望裁减联邦工作人员，经济学家预计未来几个月不会再看到这一增长。【原文：The U.S. government added 9,000 workers in January, a gain economists do not expect to see repeated in the months ahead as President Donald Trump looks to cull the ranks of the federal workforce.】

item.title: 独家报道产量减少，委内瑞拉 PDVSA 恢复轻质原油进口
item.description: 根据公司文件和船只跟踪数据，委内瑞拉国家石油公司 PDVSA 已恢复定期进口轻质原油，因为该公司自身的中质和轻质原油产量不断减少，为生产可出口的混合原油制造了瓶颈。【原文：Venezuela's state oil company PDVSA has resumed regular imports of light crude as its own output of medium and light grades dwindles, creating bottlenecks for producing exportable blends, according to company documents and vessel tracking data.】

item.title: 泰坦美国公司估值近 30 亿美元，纽交所首日股价上涨 1.25
item.description: 泰坦美国公司的股票在纽约证券交易所首次亮相时上涨了 1.25%，使这家总部位于比利时的水泥生产商的市值达到 29.9 亿美元。【原文：Shares of Titan America rose 1.25% in their debut on the New York Stock Exchange, giving the Belgium-based cement producer a market capitalization of $2.99 billion.】

item.title: 在关税压力下，锋利笔制造商纽威品牌公司努力减少对华依赖
item.description: 纽威品牌公司（Newell Brands）的首席执行官周五表示，该公司正致力于减少对中国供应商的依赖，以尽量减少美国进口关税的影响。【原文：Newell Brands' CEO said on Friday it is aiming to reduce its reliance on Chinese suppliers to minimize the impact of U.S. import tariffs, following its unexpected quarterly loss forecast.】

item.title: OpenAI 的 Altman 为欧洲设想了类似 "星际之门 "的计划
item.description: OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）周五表示，愿意将类似 "星际之门 "的人工智能项目引入欧洲，并称他的公司 "非常愿意 "在欧洲开展 "星际之门 "项目。【原文：OpenAI CEO Sam Altman on Friday signaled willingness to bring a Stargate-like artificial intelligence program to Europe, saying his company would "love" to do a Stargate Europe.】

item.title: 摩托罗拉上诉英国紧急服务网络案遭拒
item.description: 英国反垄断监管机构认定摩托罗拉在向英国紧急服务部门提供通信服务的合同中赚取了 "超常 "利润，但摩托罗拉被拒绝上诉。【原文：Motorola was refused permission to appeal against the British antitrust regulator's findings that it was making "supernormal" profits on its contract to provide communications to Britain's emergency services.】

item.title: 亚马逊从年报中删除多元化内容，企业纷纷缩减 DEI
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）周四提交的年度报告中取消了 "包容性和多样性 "的提法，而在此之前的 12 月份，亚马逊曾告诉员工，公司正在逐步减少多样性项目，这是美国企业从此类政策中广泛撤退的一部分。【原文：Amazon.com eliminated a reference to "inclusion and diversity" in its annual report filed on Thursday, after telling employees in December that it was winding down diversity programs as part of corporate America's broader retreat from such policies.】

item.title: 美联储货币政策报告标榜美国经济稳健发展
item.description: 美联储最新发布的《货币政策报告》称，美国经济状况稳健，货币政策立场将受新的经济数据驱动。【原文：The Federal Reserve's latest Monetary Policy Report describes the U.S. economy as being in a solid position amid a monetary policy stance that will be driven by incoming economic data.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士：特朗普告诉共和党议员，他计划最早于周五宣布对等关税措施
item.description: 两位熟悉计划的消息人士告诉路透社，唐纳德-特朗普总统告诉共和党议员，他计划最早于周五宣布对等关税。【原文：President Donald Trump told Republican lawmakers that he plans to announce reciprocal tariffs as early as Friday, two sources familiar with the plans told Reuters.】

item.title: 交易员认为美联储今年只会降息一次
item.description: 周五，短期利率期货交易者目前预计美联储今年只会降息一次，而不再像早些时候那样押注从6月开始降息两次，此前政府数据显示劳动力市场依然强劲，而且一项受到密切关注的调查显示消费者的通胀预期有所上升。【原文：Traders of short-term interest-rate futures on Friday now expect the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates just one time this year, backing away from earlier bets on two rate cuts starting in June, after government data showed the labor market remains strong and a closely-watched survey showed a jump in consumers' inflation expectations.】

item.title: 美国消费者信心下降，通胀预期飙升
item.description: 美国消费者情绪在2月份意外下跌至7个月来的最低点，通胀预期急剧上升，因为家庭担心，要避免唐纳德-特朗普总统威胁征收关税对其购买力造成的负面影响可能为时已晚。【原文：U.S. consumer sentiment dropped unexpectedly in February to a seven-month low and inflation expectations rocketed as households feared it may be too late to avoid the negative effects on their purchasing power from President Donald Trump's threatened tariffs.】
